The table above shows how a firm’s hourly level of output changes as more of the labor input is employed. The firm sells its output and hires labor in perfectly competitive markets. The wage paid to labor is <math alttext="$10" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> per hour, and the price of the firm’s output is <math alttext="$2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> per unit.
